_system.default_system:
System Only reverts system settings to their default values, but retains user data and shares.

Continue?
_system.default_quick:
Quick Restore reverts all settings to their default values, erases all user data and shares, and retains default shares. Quick Restore creates a new file table on the device, but does not fully overwrite or erase the drive, so data recovery programs can be used to restore user data and shares.

Continue?
_system.default_full:
Full Restore reverts all settings to their default values, deletes all user data and shares permanently, and retains default shares. Data recovery programs cannot be used to restore data; all user data and shares, with the exception of the default shares, are permanently deleted.

Continue?

_ve.desc3: Change the settings on the encrypted volume by entering the original password.
_ve.desc4: Click the Auto Mount box to automatically mount the encrypted drive at system boot up. Enter a new password and confirm that password to overwrite the original password.
_ve.desc5: Enter the password for the encrypted drive.
_ve.desc6: Wait while the drive is encrypted.
_ve.desc8: Invalid key file; could not mount Volume xxx. Please try a different key file.
_ve.desc9: Wait while the drive is decrypted.
_ve.desc10:
The My Cloud system can be encrypted with 256-bit AES encryption to protect your data from unauthorized access and theft. You can enable volume encryption at the time of creating the volume and mount it with normal read/write access privileges.

Depending on your configuration, you can also setup volume encryption to automatically mount volumes so you do not have to repeatedly enter the required encryption credentials.
_ve.msg2: The original password length cannot exceed 32 characters. Try again.
_ve.msg3: The original password cannot include the following characters: @ : / \ % '
_ve.msg4: You have entered an incorrect original password. Try again.
_ve.help_hint:
Volume encryption is a symmetric 256-bit data encryption technique. Its advantage is that it works at multiple network layers simultaneously.

Volume Encryption takes place behind the scenes. Its primary function is to code your data in a manner that other users are unable to recognize. The encryption requires a password. Once you have encrypted your data, you'll need this password to decrypt it.

Always make sure the USB storage device is formatted or all data will be lost. Your NAS currently supports 2GB/4GB/8GB/16GB/32GB devices. You can link the USB storage device directly to the NAS or through the workstation (PC) you are using.

_ddns.title: DDNS Settings
_ddns.description: The Dynamic DNS feature allows you to host a server (Web, FTP, Game Server, etc) using a domain name that you have purchased (www.whateveryournameis.com) with your dynamically assigned IP address. Most broadband Internet Service Providers assign dynamic (changing) IP addresses. Using a DDNS service provider, your friends can enter your host name to connect to your NAS no matter what your IP address is.
_ddns.help_hint: To use this feature, you must first have a Dynamic DNS account from one of the providers in the drop down menu.

_elephant_drive.title: ElephantDrive
_elephant_drive.key_featuresNote:
Protect your My Cloud system.
ElephantDrive offers a cloud storage solution, connecting and protecting your My Cloud system to the cloud. A native client provides cloud backup and syncs onto the My Cloud system with the industry's leading security features. This solution features the three critical advantages of cloud storage: separate site protection, intelligent synchronization, and simple secure sharing.

_remote_backup.remote_title6: Log in to your My Cloud account
_remote_backup.remote_title7: Where do you want to backup to ?
_remote_backup.desc:
Backup your My Cloud system to another server on or outside of your network.
Before you proceed with a remote backup, ensure the following:
  1. You have a remote My Cloud system to backup this system to. Existing shares and data from this system will be copied to the target system in addition to previously existing data.
  2. The remote Server setting is turned ON in the remote My Cloud system.
  3. The backup password for the remote My Cloud system is enabled.
  4. You have added port forwarding rules for both SSH and Remote Backup services in Settings > Network > Port Forwarding in order to see your My Cloud system over the internet.

_sms.title: SMS Setting
_sms.description: The SMS Settings menu allows you to setup event alerts to be sent to a mobile phone in the form of an SMS text message. You need a mobile phone and subscription with an SMS Gateway provider who must provide a valid HTTP API URL to use for the configuration. Once the SMS settings are configured, any time a checked event, under the Event Settings menu, occurs an event alert will be sent to the configured mobile(s) as a text message.
_sms.name: Provider Name
_sms.url2: Enter a SMS URL with the message content set to be "Hello world"
_sms.sms_description: *This SMS URL is only for setup purposes. No SMS message will be sent after setup is completed. The format of this URL is provided by the SMS service provider, and the URL must include the following parameters: username, password, destination phone, and message content. Using Clickatell as an example, a possible URL is: https://api.clickatell.com/http/sendmsg?user=TestUser&password=TestPassword&api_id=3148203&to=886123456789&text=Hello.

_s3.step1_desc: Enter a 16-character Job Name that identifies either the upload-to-cloud or the download-to-cloud job to be created. The Job Name cannot contain spaces. The following characters are allowed: a-z, A-Z, 0-9.
_s3.step2_desc: Enter your Amazon S3 assigned Access and Private keys. The keys allow your My Cloud system access to your Amazon S3 Cloud Storage. In the Remote Path field, enter a new or existing Amazon S3 Bucket name. This is a folder on the Cloud Storage to which your data will be written to or read from. Finally select the appropriate region that will give you the best service for reading from or writing to the Amazon S3 Cloud.
_s3.step3_desc:
In the Type drop-down menu select Upload if you wish to backup your My Cloud system data to the Amazon S3 Cloud. Select Download if you wish to backup data from the Amazon S3 Cloud to the WD My Cloud EX2 Ultra device.

In the Backup Type drop-down menu, select Overwrite Existing Files to write over any files in the target folder with the source files with identical names. Select Full Backup to create a separate folder containing all backup data for each time the job is executed. Select Incremental Backup to write over files with source files that are newer than the target folder files.
_s3.step4_desc: In the Local_Path field, enter the full path name of the source or target directory folder for the job (e.g. Volume_1/backup_docs).
_s3.step5_desc: Select the appropriate Schedule Mode to use when the job is executed. Click Manual to start the job at a later time using a manually clicked button. Click Once to schedule a date and time to run the job one time only. Click Schedule to set a daily time for the job to run on a daily basis.
_s3.step6_desc: Review all your settings and click Previous to go back to make any changes. Click Exit to exit the wizard without saving the job. Click Finish to save the job and exit the wizard.
_s3.msg29: The setting is complete. Click Finish to save your current settings
_s3.desc: Amazon S3 (Simple Storage Service) is an online file storage web service offered by Amazon Web Services. It provides storage through web services interfaces to backup data on your device to the cloud.

_dfs.dfs_description: <!--DFS is a method of storing and accessing files based in a client/NAS architecture. Any number of remote computers can access these files on the NAS with the proper authorization rights. DFS uses a uniform naming convention and a mapping scheme to keep track of where files are located. When you try to retrieve a file from the NAS, the file appears as a normal file, and you are able to work with the file in the same way as if it were stored locally on your hard drive. When you are finished working with the file, it is returned over the network to the NAS, which stores the now-altered file for retrieval at a later time.--> In a Distributed File System, one or more central servers store files that can be accessed, with proper authorization rights, by any number of remote clients in the network. Click Enable to activate this feature.

_raid.desc3: All RAID Volumes are active and healthy.
_raid.desc19: The use of one or more drives not in a RAID configuration but managed as separate logical volumes.
_raid.desc27: Combination of drives in a linear fashion to create one large logical volume.
_raid.desc28: Data is striped across multiple hard drives, enabling accelerated reading and recording of data by combining the work of two or more drives to increase performance.
_raid.desc29: Two instantaneous copies of the data are recorded on separate hard drives so that, if one of them fails, the other(s) continue to read/write data until the faulty hard drive is replaced.
_raid.desc30: Offers superior performance and protection by striping data across 3 or more drives and dedicating a quarter of each drive to fault tolerance.
_raid.desc31: RAID protocol in which data is written in stripes across primary disks that have been mirrored to the secondary disks.
_raid.desc32: You can specify RAID size settings through the slider below. If you are not using the total volume capacity, you may choose to configure the remaining space as Spanning.
_raid.desc33: Configure RAID 5+spare (click Create Spare Disk box). "Disk4" will then become the hot spare. Deselect Create Spare Disk if you do not want to create a RAID 5+spare. Resize the RAID 5 volume and if you do not use all the space, check Configure the remaining disk space as Spanning. Click Next to continue.
_raid.desc35: This section allows you to rebuild the RAID if it becomes corrupted. Enable Auto-Rebuild to automatically rebuild the RAID once the disk is recognized.
_raid.desc39: This section allows you to set up a password for the selected volume. Select Auto Mount to automatically mount the encrypted volume without re-entering the password at boot up.

_cloud.desc: Generate an activation code to get remote access to the content on your drive.
_cloud.step_desc:
Steps:
  1. Select a user from the drop-down list and click Get Code to generate an activation code.
  2. Install WD Photos and/or My Cloud on your tablet or mobile device.
  3. Launch app and tap Connect Now.
  4. Select your product.
  5. Enter Activation Code.

_cloud.disable_desc2: To enable Cloud Access, navigate to Settings > General > Cloud Access.

_cloud.reg_desc2: Please allow some time for the email to arrive in the user's inbox. Instructions for obtaining remote access to the content on your drive are provided.
_cloud.update_desc: Change the email address for your MyCloud.com account.
_cloud.about_cloud: Before a smart phone or tablet can access the content on your drive, you need to register it as part of your personal cloud ecosystem. You generate a code that will pair your mobile device with the drive.
_cloud.invite: Invite others to your personal cloud
_cloud.enable_desc:
Enabling access to this Dashboard web interface outside of your current network helps you manage this device remotely. However, it also slightly increases risks for unauthorized access on your WD My Cloud EX2 Ultra .

Are you sure you want to enable this feature?
_cloud.enable_desc2:
Enabling access to this Dashboard web interface outside of your current network helps you manage this device remotely. However, it also slightly increases risks for unauthorized access on your WD My Cloud EX2 Ultra .Certain functions such as adding a new user will not be available outside of your network.

To ensure security, you will need to enter an administrator password for this device before enabling this feature.
_cloud.auto_desc: Attempts to establish a direct connection between your device and the router.
_cloud.manual_desc: Manually configure your router to work with your device. Learn More >>
_cloud.xp_desc: Attempts to establish a direct or relay connection, as appropriate for Windows XP compatibility.

_cloud.not_allow_desc:
This action is not allowed because you're accessing the dashboard (web interface) from outside the device's local network.

Access this interface from your device's local network to complete this action.

_tip.scan: Scans the hard drive(s) in the My Cloud EX2 Ultra system for any error.
_tip.restore: Create a backup prior to using any restore option. Use System only to restore system data to the originial factory settings. Quick Restore erases content and system info but can be recovered with recovery software; Full Restore permanently deletes all content and system info, and cannot be recovered. Be sure to create a backup prior to using any restore option.
_tip.config: Save the current configuration settings. Or import stored configuration settings.
_tip.smart: Quick Test quickly scans and tests the My Cloud EX2 Ultra system's hard drive(s) for potential failures. Full Test scans the entire system hard drive(s) and may take several hours to complete.
_tip.gen_ntp: Enable NTP service to synchronize with your network and automatically update the date and time.
_tip.gen_tm: Enable Time Machine backups to this device.
_tip.gen_dfs: Share Aggregation is similar to Distributed File System (DFS), which consolidates shares from other My Cloud systems or network devices that support the SMB protocol.
_tip.gen_ads: Enable/Disable Active Directory service to allow your WD My Cloud EX2 Ultra device to join an existing Windows domain.
_tip.gen_drive: Enable sleep mode on your drive to save energy.
_tip.gen_lcd: Turns on or off the system LCD. During off mode, pressing a button on the unit will turn on the LCD for 10 seconds.
_tip.gen_cloud: Enables/Disables cloud access to your device.
_tip.gen_status: Displays the current status of your cloud access connection.
_tip.gen_timeout: Configure the default time to enforce automatic system log out.
_tip.gen_recovery: The Power Recovery feature automatically restarts your device from a previously unexpected shutdown due to a power failure.
_tip.s3: Create a new Amazon S3 Backup job
_tip.s3_backup: Specify the Amazon S3 bucket or root directory path for your backup.
_tip.s3_auto: Automatically update your backup based on a schedule.
_tip.recycle: Contain any files deleted from the network share that can either be recovered or permanently deleted.
_tip.webdav: WebDAV allows files to be managed and edited over HTTP in a way that allows multiple users to collaborate.
_tip.nfs: NFS (Network File System) is a protocol that allows a user to access files over a network. Common with Unix, Linux and some versions of Mac OSx.
_tip.host: Enter IP addresses that you would like to allow NFS access to this share. To allow all IP addresses, enter *.
_tip.root: Enable this option to remove root level NFS permissions from users, if necessary.
_tip.write: Enable this option to open up write permissions through NFS on this share.
_tip.remote_ip: Enter the IP address of the remote server you would like to use to backup this device.
_tip.autoupdate_remote: Enable/Disable a schedule to automatically update your Remote Backup.
_tip.cloud_status: Displays the current status of your cloud access connection.
_tip.group: Groups can be created in the main user page.
_tip.public: Enables or Disables public access to the share. Setting this value to ON will allow anyone on your network access to files on this share. This option is only enabled when one or more user accounts are created.
_tip.afp: Enable or Disable the Apple File Protocol Service. This option is enabled automatically if you are setup for Time Machine backups.
_tip.lltd: Enable or Disable the Link Layer Topology Discovery protocol for enhanced network discovery and diagnostics on Microsoft Windows machines.
_tip.snmp: Enable or Disable the Simple Network Management Protocol service for managing devices over IP networks.
_tip.snmp_1: Use the Simple Network Management Protocol service for managing devices over IP networks.
_tip.snmp_2:
NoAuthNoPriv: Messages are not authenticated and not encrypted.
AuthNoPriv: Messages are authenticated but not encrypted.
AuthPriv: Messages are authenticated and encrypted.
_tip.snmp_3:
Indicate level of user access.
System: Only allow to query device’s system information.
Network: Only allow to query device’s network information.
All: Allow to query all device information.
_tip.ssh: Enable Secure Shell (SSH) connections to SSH applications over the network.
_tip.ddns: The Dynamic DNS feature allows you to host a server (Web, FTP, Game Server, etc...) using a domain name.
_tip.remote: Enable the My Cloud system to act as a remote server and be able to backup shares from another compatible My Cloud EX2 Ultra system on the LAN or WAN.
_tip.bonding: Also called Bonding and refers to the use of two network interfaces, present in your NAS, and two cables connected to your router simultaneously. This improves performance and reliability.
_tip.jumbo: Jumbo frames are large IP frames used to increase performance over supported networks.
_tip.ipv4: Select Static to enter IP address, subnet mask, and gateway information, or DHCP (Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol) to have the network retrieve IP address assignments and other configuration information.
_tip.ipv6: IPv6 is the new IP standard that specifies the formats of packets and the addressing scheme across multiple IP networks.
_tip.ftp: File Transfer Protocol (FTP) is a standard network protocol used to transfer data from one computer to another over the internet.
_tip.workgroup: Workgroups let devices in the same workgroup access one another, and are only available for the Windows system. Each time you add a device to your network, assign it the same workgroup name.
_tip.lmb: Enables/Disables domain master browser to collect and record resource and/or service information across multiple subnets.
_tip.speed: Select either 'Auto','100', or '1000'. Auto works in all scenarios.
_tip.port_forwarding: Manage your connections to particular services by assigning default or custom port numbers.
_tip.user_prefix: Enter a prefix for the username. Prefixes cannot contain any spaces.
_tip.account_prefix: Enter a numerical value for the Account Prefix. The Account prefix will be added to the username prefix.
_tip.wfs_upload: Click to upload one or more files to your My Cloud system.
_tip.iso_overwrite: Select overwrite to copy over files with the same name.
_tip.cloud_automatic:
Automatic: Establishes a direct connection between your device and the router using uPnP. If the connection cannot open the ports on your router, a relay connection is established.

Manual: Establishes a connection through the two selected ports. If either port is unavailable, a relay connection is established. Manual router configuration is required.

Windows XP Compatibility: Establishes a connection through ports 80 and 443. If these ports are unavailable, a relay connection is established. Required for Windows XP.
_tip.cloud_rebuild: Rebuild your MyCloud.com database. Use only for troubleshooting when database corruption is suspected.
_tip.dashboard: Enable or Disable access to this web interface through the Internet by setting up and forwarding the desired external port on your router to the internal default port (port 80) of this device.
_tip.ftp_enable: Enable/Disable FTP access to this share.
_tip.ftp_disable: FTP access is currently disabled for this system. Enable your FTP Settings by navigating to Settings > Network and try again.
_tip.nfs_disable: NFS access is currently disabled for this system. Enable your NFS Settings by navigating to Settings > Network and try again.
_tip.webdav_enable: Enable WebDAV protocol to allow web access to the content within the same network.
_tip.webdav_disable: WebDAV access is currently disabled for this system. Enable your WebDAV Settings by navigating to Settings > Network and try again.
_tip.autofw: Firmware updates, when available, will occur at 3AM and will require a reboot. To configure autoupdate settings, navigate to Settings >> Firmware Update.
_tip.sms: Receive system notifications through Short Message Service (SMS).
_tip.ups: You can configure this system to be responsible for communicating UPS status to other devices (Master mode) or have it communicate with the UPS Master to receive UPS status and commands (Slave mode).
_tip.account_mail: Give user cloud access by entering their email. Login instructions are sent to the email address provided.
_tip.smb2: Enable SMB2 to support Windows File History in Windows 8.
_tip.p2p_port: To enable port settings, navigate to Settings > Network > Port Forwarding > Add and enable the appropriate service from the list.
_tip.system_test: Perform a system test to check your unit for memory, temperature, fan and other related errors.
_tip.wipe: Formats the hard drive(s) in the My Cloud EX2 Ultra system. All the data on the drive(s) will be permanently deleted.
_tip.raid: Automatically rebuilds the RAID volumes on your system when you add or remove hard drive(s).
_tip.fdownload_url: File paths and file names are case sensitive.
_tip.camera_auto: Files are automatically transferred to your device when you connect your camera to the My Cloud system.
_tip.camera_copy: Copy duplicates the files on your camera and transfers them to your My Cloud system.
_tip.camera_move: Move transfers files from your camera to the My Cloud system, but the camera content gets deleted.
_tip.smb: Enable or disable access to this SAMBA interface.
_tip.oplocks: Enabling Oplocks can improve Samba performance by caching files on the SMB client.
_tip.media_enable: Enable/Disable Media Serving to this share.
_tip.media_disable: Media Serving is currently disabled. Navigate to Settings > Media to enable the Media Server.
_tip.media_serving: Media serving option enables and disables this share with DLNA and iTunes server.
_tip.extendedlog: Capture extended logs in system diagnostic report.
_tip.improvement: The Product Improvement Program collects and periodically sends diagnostic and usage information, which helps WD improve the quality and performance of our products. This information generally includes device, application and service usage, as well as error diagnostics. This may include items such as device configuration, CPU and other usage statistics by application, API calls, service crash information, network status, storage utilization, and size and type of files.
_tip.fdownload_lang: Set to the correct encoding scheme used by the host FTP site
_tip.ad_domain: Enter the fully qualified domain name (FQDN) of the Active Directory to join.

_iscsi.title: iSCSI Targets
_iscsi.desc:
Your My Cloud system allows you to create and manage iSCSI targets. The iSCSI target provides storage, similar to a local hard disk drive, but is accessed over a network rather than locally. The iSCSI target is also protected by the underlying RAID structure of the WD My Cloud EX2 Ultra server.

To create iSCSI targets, click the Create iSCSI Target button below.
_iscsi.desc1: If you would like to create a iSCSI target from an existing image file, click here
_iscsi.initi_list: The following list indicates the initiators currently connected to your iSCSI target.
_iscsi.name: Name
_iscsi.no_list: No iSCSI Target(s) have been added to the My Cloud system.
_iscsi.msg1: The first character of the Target name must be: "a-z" or "0-9".
_iscsi.msg2: The Target name only allows the following characters: "a-z" , "0-9" , "-" , "." and ":".
_iscsi.msg3: The maximum number of iSCSI Target(s) has been reached.
_iscsi.msg6: The password must be at least 12 characters in length. Please try again.
_iscsi.msg10: You cannot decrease the size of an existing iSCSI target.
_iscsi.msg11: Target size can not be large than
_iscsi.msg13: Do you want to remove the image file?
_iscsi.msg14: The iSCSI target alias can not contain uppercase letters.
_iscsi.msg16: The beginning of the name cannot contain snapshots
_iscsi.msg17: The beginning of the name cannot contain shap-
_iscsi.msg24: The Target name only allows the following characters: "a-z" , "0-9" , "-" , "." and ":". Do not include spaces.

getting_start.desc1: WD My Cloud EX2 Ultra lets you create your personal cloud. Store your photos, videos, music, and files in one place, and access your content anywhere. Access requires a MyCloud.com account, and each user needs one.
getting_start.desc2: Entering your email address registers your system and sets you up to receive updates and info about WD My Cloud EX2 Ultra .
getting_start.desc3: If you do not wish to add other users now, click Next to continue.
getting_start.desc4: Thank you for your registration. Your registration has been submitted.
getting_start.desc7: Registering your product helps register your warranty & sets you up to receive updates about your product.
getting_start.desc9: This is going to be the most exciting time of your whole life. Download:
getting_start.more_2: You'll receive an email from MyCloud.com with our login info.
getting_start.more_3: Click these links for additional software and info:
getting_start.auto: Automatically update system firmware when available.
getting_start.register: Register the My Cloud system to receive continuous product support.
getting_start.imp: Participate in the Product Improvement Program.
getting_start.auto_tip: Automatically updates your device firmware when it is available.
getting_start.imp_tip: Participate in WD's Product Improvement Program to help WD offer product improvements.

_support.title: Support
_support.desc1:
Selecting Automated Customer Support generates and attaches a comprehensive diagnostic report to your support request, including your system's serial number, MAC address, and other status information. Your request is then routed to a team of experts to assist you as quickly and efficiently as possible.

To include your report with your support request, select the Attach my system's diagnostic report and request option; then click Request Support.

To submit a support request without attaching a system diagnostic report, please submit a request through our standard support page.
_support.desc2: Create a system report and save it to your drive to identify and resolve network issues.
_support.desc4:
• You will be helping drive future updates to our products.
  • It will enable our support team to help you more efficiently.
  • You can stop participating at any time.
_support.sel_desc: Attach my system's diagnostic report and request support

_share_aggregation.desc: Consolidate distributed resources by creating local shares that provide access to shares on other My Cloud systems.
_share_aggregation.tip1: The Root Folder will act as a container for the linked remote shares and is created under the Share Aggregation share.
_share_aggregation.tip2: Add links to aggregate remote shares.
_share_aggregation.tip3: Name for the folder displayed under the Root Folder.
_share_aggregation.tip4: Please enter the hostname or IP address of the target device.
_share_aggregation.tip5: Manually enter in the remote share name or click Get Remote Share List to display the Remote Host shares.
